Young woman with ipsilateral right limb ataxia and gaze‑evoked nystagmus localises to the right cerebellar hemisphere. Concomitant right‑leg‑predominant UMN weakness with hyperreflexia/clonus and distal sensory loss is best explained by a single lesion in the contralateral medial frontoparietal (leg) cortex. Left RAPD and reduced acuity indicate a left optic nerve lesion. Multifocal CNS involvement suggests dissemination in space.
